page.title: 04SCISSETT FROM 1915 ONWARDS
page.content: Over the last 70 years Scissett has changed completely. Going down the main road these are the main changes... There was a chemist where the Phoenix Textiles showroom is. There was a draper's and milliners where the bank was.The boutique "Bacall" was called "Barous,Draper's and Grocers and Corn Merchants". A row of 28 houses became the Clinic and Doctor's. The building which was Fine Design, was a CO-OP and previously the infant school.The CO-OP was originally beside the pelican crossing with missionary buildings on the top floor. This is now a block of flats.The flats behind were open fields and a dam was built there.The wool shop Jean's - was a tailors shop.The newsagents was a Conservative Club.
